item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Socialism never took root in America because the poor see themselves not as an exploited proletariat but as temporarily embarrassed millionaires." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Maybe everâ€™body in the whole damn world is scared of each other." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I was born lost and take no pleasure in being found." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "To be alive at all is to have scars. " -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Can you honestly love a dishonest thing?" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "People who are most afraid of their dreams convince themselves they don't dream at all." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "A sad soul can kill you quicker, far quicker, than a germ." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Do you take pride in your hurt? Does it make you seem large and tragic? ...Well, think about it. Maybe you're playing a part on a great stage with only yourself as audience." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "A man without words is a man without thought." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "People like you to be something, preferably what they are." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It would be absurd if we did not understand both angels and devils, since we invented them." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "If you're in trouble, or hurt or need - go to the poor people. They're the only ones that'll help - the only ones." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Intention, good or bad, is not enough." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder why progress looks so much like destruction." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "My imagination will get me a passport to hell one day." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "An unbelieved truth can hurt a man much more than a lie. It takes great courage to back truth unacceptable to our times. There's a punishment for it, and it's usually crucifixion." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Perhaps the less we have, the more we are required to brag." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Perhaps it takes courage to raise children.." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Man has a choice and it's a choice that makes him a man." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I'll want to hear,' Samuel said. 'I eat stories like grapes." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "The free exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rita add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There are no ugly questions except those clothed in condescension." -- John Steinbeck
